Class fuzzy.FuzzyBlockOfRules 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----fuzzy.FuzzyBlockOfRules
public class FuzzyBlockOfRules
extends Object
Class for a block of fuzzy rules

FuzzyBlockOfRules(String)
Constructor
FuzzyBlockOfRules(String[])
Constructor

evaluateBlock()
This function evaluates this block, does not return any diagnostic information.
evaluateBlockText()
This function evaluates this block, returns a lava.lang.String containing evaluation result for every expression in the rule.
isRuleFired()
Returns true if any rule in the block has fired during a call to evaluateBlock() or evaluateBlockText().
parseBlock()
Parse the rules in the block.
setFuzzyEngine(FuzzyEngine)
Set the pointer to the fuzzy engine.

FuzzyBlockOfRules 
 public FuzzyBlockOfRules(String rules[])
Constructor

Parameters:
rules[] - one-dimensional array of java.lang.String, containing all rules that will constitute this block
FuzzyBlockOfRules 
 public FuzzyBlockOfRules(String rules)
Constructor

Parameters:
rules - a java.lang.String, containing all rules that will constitute this block (separated by \n)

evaluateBlockText 
 public String evaluateBlockText() throws EvaluationException
This function evaluates this block, returns a lava.lang.String containing evaluation result for every expression in the rule. This function can be called only after parseBlock().

evaluateBlock 
 public void evaluateBlock() throws EvaluationException
This function evaluates this block, does not return any diagnostic information. This function can be called only after parseBlock().

isRuleFired 
 public boolean isRuleFired()
Returns true if any rule in the block has fired during a call to evaluateBlock() or evaluateBlockText().

Returns:
boolean
parseBlock 
 public void parseBlock() throws RulesParsingException
Parse the rules in the block. This call is only possible after the block has been registered with a fuzzy engine.

Throws: RulesParsingException
Exception is thrown if any rule within block generates a parsing error
setFuzzyEngine 
 public void setFuzzyEngine(FuzzyEngine newFuzzyEngine)
Set the pointer to the fuzzy engine. This function is for the call FuzzyEngine.register(FuzzyBlockOfRules)

Parameters:
newFuzzyEngine - Pointer to the fuzzy engine that will parse and compile this block of rules
